project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase a mobile health clinic for the Fallon Paiute Shoshone Tribe (FPST) in Nevada. The FPST has an agreement with two other tribes in the area to provide health care to tribal members. funding_code: CF ARP EMERGENCY RURAL HEALTH CARE GRANTS - TRACK 1 & 2
naics_industry_sector: Other or Not Defined
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to support the Nevada Health Center as it provides healthcare assistance to underserved populations, rural and border communities, and those living in communities at high risk for infectious disease, hospitalization, and mortality. Nevada Health Center will use funds to serve the rural population of the Amargosa Valley as they address ongoing and immediate needs related to the COVID-19 pandemic. Many rural Nevada counties are experiencing elevated COVID-19 risk due to lagging vaccination rates, higher case counts, and hospitalizations. With limited number of medical facilities in Amargosa Valley, high rates of chronic diseases may increase the severity of COVID-19 infections. This initiative will help sustain and prepare for future pandemic events; increase access to quality health care services, including continued testing and vaccination capability; attainment of medical supplies and equipment to increase medical surge capacity, and recovery of loss revenue from the pandemic impact.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
funding_code: REAP IRA RES GRANT UNRESTRICTED (FY 22/23)
naics_industry_sector: Manufacturing (31-33)
project_announced_description: This RD investment will be used to assist Freedom Solar construct a total of 657.66 kilowatt (kW) of photovoltaic (PV) solar arrays at Scougal Rubber Corporation construction site. The systems will be roof mounted and carports will be installed on property owned by Scougal Rubber. The estimated yearly energy generation is 977,632 kilowatt hours (kWh) or $108,686.61 per year. Scougal Rubber is within the Reno-Tahoe Industrial Center, which is home to other REAP applicants, and will in the future host large corporations such as Google and Tesla. REAPs presence in the RTIC has huge potential for the future of the Center and for Nevada.

funding_code: FY22 CONGRESSIONALLY DIRECTED SPENDING
naics_industry_sector: Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting (11)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used for improvements to the existing Virginia City fairgrounds, including extending the existing water main at F Street into the fairgrounds and the installation of electrical power to the fairgrounds via underground conduit. The proposed project will extend the public water main to provide a new fire hydrant near the parking area, and a water line to a two-inch frost-free yard-hydrant, which will provide water for animals and dust control. Additionally, the new fire hydrant can be used in case of emergency, ensuring residents and visitors of Storey County are safe in crisis scenarios. Other site improvements include the installation of electrical power to the fairgrounds via underground conduit. The proposed project will improve the health, sanitation, and operational security of the Virginia City Fairgrounds for both residents and visitors.
